Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Uncertainty \Un*cer"tain*ty\, n.; pl. {Uncertainties}. [1913 Webster] 1. The quality or state of being uncertain. [1913 Webster]
2. That which is uncertain; something unknown. [1913 Webster]
Our shepherd's case is every man's case that quits a moral certainty for an uncertainty. --L'Estrange. [1913 Webster]

uncertainty n 1: being unsettled or in doubt; "the uncertainty of the outcome" [syn: {uncertainness}] [ant: {certainty}] 2: the state of being unsure of something [syn: {doubt}, {incertitude}, {dubiety}, {doubtfulness}, {dubiousness}] [ant: {certainty}]
